title: Wall Street Warns of a Deepening Oil Glut in 2026
summary: Oversupplied markets will keep oil prices under pressure next year, and the U.S. benchmark will average below $60 per barrel, the monthly Reuters poll of analysts and economists showed on Friday. title: It’s not just gamblers taking a punt on prediction markets
summary: Legal wrangling over ‘event contracts’ has not deterred gaming groups and exchange operators from seeking a slice of the action

title: Saudi Arabia Set to Slash Oil Prices to Asia for January
summary: Saudi Arabia is expected to slash the prices for its crude bound for Asia in January to the lowest premium to benchmarks in five years, as the world’s largest crude exporter looks to preserve market share amid ample supply and falling spot Middle East benchmarks. title: Oil Prices Headed for Fourth Monthly Loss as Glitch Halts Trading
summary: Oil prices were headed for a fourth consecutive monthly loss early on Friday as a data center glitch forced CME Group to halt trading in futures and options, disrupting oil futures trades as well as equities, bonds, and foreign exchange. “Due to a cooling issue at CyrusOne data centers, our markets…

title: Petrobras Cuts Capex Plan on Lower Oil Prices
summary: Brazil’s energy major Petrobras has revised its spending plans for the next five years, prompted by the steady and persistent decline in oil prices. The company now plans to spend 2% less than previously expected over the period between 2026 and 2030. Petrobras will also pay less dividend, Reuters …

title: U.S. LNG Exports Set to Surge 40% as Europe Buys Record Volumes
summary: Exports of liquefied natural gas from the United States are on track to book a 40% annual increase this month, hitting 10.7 million tons, projections from Kpler have shown, as cited by Bloomberg. title: UK Auto Production Plunges 31% as Cyberattack and Weak Exports Bite
summary: UK automotive production plunged in October, with combined car and commercial vehicle output falling 30.9% year-on-year to 62,116 units, according to new data released by the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders (SMMT). title: Nigeria Boosts Gas Supply With OML 17 Output Surge
summary: The Nigerian National Petroleum Company (NNPC) and its partner, Heirs Energies, have successfully doubled natural gas production at a key oil block, OML 17, as part of a broader strategy to boost domestic supply and ease the country's electricity shortages.
